about_the_product:
About the Product:
Red chilli powder is abundantly used in various regular to the exotic dishes. It adds texture, colour, spice and punch to the Indian food to enhance the taste, flavour and look of the dish. Catch Red Chilli powder is made by Low Temperature Grinding Technology. The raw material is sourced from the prime spice growing farms of Guntur(Andhra Pradesh) & Byadigi (Karnataka), which not only makes the food taste good but also provides health benefits. It is an important ingredient for preparing chutneys, curries, gravies and sauces.
How to Use:
Add Catch Red Chilli Powder to your dishes to make it a treat. Keep in a cool & dry place. Once opened, use an airtight container to keep the aroma intact. |
Features:
Spice Up Your Meals: Enhance your regular and exotic dishes with the perfect spiciness of Catch Red Chilli Powder. Perfect Colour: It adds the perfect texture & colour to all the dishes. Sourced From Best Farms: The Catch Lal Mirchi Powder is sourced from the farms of Guntur (Andhra Pradesh) & Byadigi (Karnataka). High In Quality: The Catch Spices are ground to perfection with no added fillers. Packed Hygienically: Catch Spices are packed hygienically, ensuring minimal human contact. Also Try: Try Catch Turmeric Powder, Catch Coriander Powder, Catch Jeera Powder, Catch Kasuri Methi, Catch Kashmiri Mirch Powder, Catch Black Pepper Powder & more.

about_the_product:
About the Product:
Zoff Poppy Seed Whole is the ideal way to bring crunch to food. 

Poppy seeds are touted for their ability to ease digestion, improve skin and hair health, and alleviate headaches, coughs, and asthma. The potassium content in Poppy seeds helps treat kidney stones and prevents their re-occurrence. They are typically used to add flavour, texture and crunch to food. Poppy seeds can be eaten whole, ground up, added to a meal, or pressed for poppy seed oil. Poppy seeds can be used on bakery products, like bagels or lemon poppy muffins, but they also can be added to salads and vegetables.

Explore a range of premium quality spices, groceries, pulses, masalas and more from Zoff only on Big Basket.

product_USP: Pro Weight Watchers, High in Omega 3
about_the_product:
About the Product:
You work hard to stay fit and watch your weight. So when it comes to food, it is important that you make the right choices to ensure your efforts are fruitful.
Oil is an essential ingredient in your meals.
Most often, the first step will be to reduce the amount of oil used. But that might not be enough.
You need to choose the right cooking oil that works as hard as you do.
Saffola Active blended edible oil comes with LOSORBâ„¢ technology which results in upto 27% lesser oil* so that you consume less oil every meal.
Saffola Active cooking oil is high in Omega-3 (alpha linolenic acid), which contributes to the maintenance of normal blood cholesterol levels.
Saffola Active Dual Seed Technology gives you the goodness of 2 oils in 1.
It ensures a good balance of MUFA and PUFA for better nutrition through fats, compared to single seed oils.
Since quantity of oil consumed every day is as important as the quality of oil you choose for daily cooking, Saffola Active blended edible vegetable oil helps you ensure both.
Boost your efforts to stay active by choosing Saffola Active! *as compared to commonly consumed cooking oils; basis frying studies on potato, 2018.

About the Product:
Flaxseeds have a mild savor and are well-known for providing strong omega-3 fatty acids and fiber.
They have a hard but soft and glossy outer shell. The color of this seed ranges from deep amber to reddish-brown. It has a lukewarm, type of silly and simple flavor.
This is cultivated without the use of pesticides, artificial fertilizers or chemicals.
Nutritional Facts:
Calories: 534,
Carbs: 29 g,
Fat: 42 g,
Protein: 18 g.
How to Use:
Combine water, frozen banana, frozen mango, flax seeds, fresh baby spinach, orange juice, fresh ginger in a blender and blend until smooth.
Serve right away for the best taste and texture.
Benefits:
Flaxseed is commonly used to improve digestive health or relieve constipation.
Flaxseed may also help lower total blood cholesterol and low-density lipoprotein cholesterol levels, which may help reduce the risk of heart disease.
Flaxseed may have a protective effect against cancer.

About the Product:
• Fine ground, highly aromatic Allepey pepper acclaimed for its superb flavour and bite. These bold berried peppers are sourced from the erstwhile shipping port Allepey - a Southern district of Kerala.
• Pepper has a sharp, hot and biting taste. Its a warming spice. It is one of the oldest and important spices in the world. So important, that in ancient times it was used to pay taxes. In 410 A.D, when the Huns lay seige of Rome, 3000 pounds of pepper was demanded as ransom.
• India holds a supreme position in the production of pepper. Two of its celebrated varieties are Malabar Garbled and Tellichery Extra bold. The finest Indian pepper is grown in the monsoon forests of the Malabar coast in Kerala.
How to Use:
Pepper is extensively used in the wintry cusine of North India, to impart warmth and pungency to veg. dishes. In the South, it is used as a flavouring spice in non-veg preparations. Pepper incidentally is an important spice in the Indian four-spice classic Garam Masala. Pepper corns boiled in water along with basil leaves, are said to relieve chest congestions and asthematic condition.

About the Product:
Star anise is a spice renowned for its distinct, star-shaped appearance and strong, sweet aroma. Widely used in culinary traditions across the globe, it imparts a unique licorice-like flavour to both savoury and sweet dishes. Commonly found in Asian cuisine, star anise enhances the taste of broths, marinades, and baked goods. Its striking shape also makes it a popular garnish. Valued for its versatility and bold flavour, star anise is a staple in many spice collections.
Benefits:
Rich in antioxidants
How to Use:
Star anise traditionally is used in savoury recipes particularly with meats.It often is added whole to soups, stews and braising broths to which it adds a sweet-liquorice-peppery flavour.

About the Product:
Star anise is the dried, star-shaped fruit of Illicium verum. It is dark brown in colour with eight segments. It has a sweetish liquorice taste. It is a major component of garam masala, in Indian cuisine. It has a sweet but pungent, fennel-like aroma with a spicy warmth.
Nutritional Facts:
Calories: 14,
Carbs: 3 g,
Fat: 0 g,
Protein: 1 g.
How to Use:
Star anise traditionally is used in savory recipes, particularly with meats.
It often is added whole to soups, stews and braising broths, to which it adds a sweet-licorice-peppery flavor.
Benefits:
The oil produced from star anise contains thymol, terpineol and anethole, which is used for treating cough and flu.
Anise also helps improve digestion, alleviate cramps and reduce nausea.
Consuming star anise tea after meals helps treat digestive ailments such as bloating, gas, indigestion and constipation.

About the Product:
Sabja seeds, also known as basil seeds or falooda seeds, are widely used in Asian and Middle Eastern cuisines. They are obtained from the sweet basil plant, and are tiny, round, and black. When soaked in water, these seeds swell up and exhibit a gelatinous exterior. This unique property makes them a popular addition to various drinks and desserts. One of the most common uses is in a popular Indian dessert called falooda, where they add a delightful crunch and interesting texture. Sabja seeds also play a role in Ayurvedic and Chinese medicine due to their therapeutic properties. Despite their minute size, these seeds are packed with nutrients. Their mild flavour allows them to blend seamlessly with a variety of dishes, enhancing the dish without overpowering it. Thus, sabja seeds are a versatile ingredient that adds both nutritional value and an intriguing texture to meals.

product_desc: A2 Desi Hallikar Cow Ghee - Vedic Bilona Churned From Curd, 1 L Each
about_the_product:
About the Product:
PURE A2 VEDIC GHEE: Anveshan A2 VEDIC ghee is nutritious, healthy, and pure with A2 proteins made from A2 milk of Indian native cows. Unlike other ghee products that claim to be organic and without lactose, our ghee butter is 100% natural, produced by grass-fed Indian desi cow milk. The premium A2 milk from the Hallikar cows is first turned into curd by using a microbe culture. We then churn the curd with Bilona Method as mentioned in Ayurveda for hours to separate the butter before boiling it to turn it into ghee. 1L of our ghee comes from 25 litres of milk. Anveshan Vedic ghee contains no additives, no preservatives and no added colours, just wholesome goodness. Cow A2 Cultured Ghee is gluten-free, easy to digest and safe for most people with lactose or casein sensitivities. Harlikar cows are known for producing highly regarded A2 milk. Unlike regular milk, A2 milk contains only A2 protein which is healthier and safer than A1 protein.
VEDIC GHEE BENEFITS:

Maintain Healthy Heart, Strengthen Immune system and bones,
Eliminate toxin from the body,
Boost energy level and Good for skin & hair.
Ingredients:
Pure A2 Hallikar Cow Milk
Nutritional Facts:

Cooking, topping over curries, rice, dal. Deep frying, skin massage, hair massage.

About the Product:
We bring you the goodness of real coconuts with Tata Simply Better 100% Pure and Unrefined Cold Pressed Virgin Coconut Oil. Extracted from A1 grade coconuts, this cold-pressed coconut oil ensures purity and aroma in every drop. Cold pressing technology helps preserve the vital nutrients, rich aroma, and flavour of real coconuts, making it suitable for cooking as well as for raw consumption. Tata Simply Better Cold Pressed Coconut Oil is naturally cholesterol-free, 0% trans-fat-free, helps boost energy with 60% MCTs, and is an alternative to refined oils. So, without giving a second thought, make Tata Simply Better Cold Pressed Virgin Coconut Oil - your cooking partner and a part of your daily regime.
Features:
Bring home the goodness of pure coconuts with Tata Simply Better 100% Pure and Unrefined Cold Pressed Virgin Coconut Oil. Tata Simply Better Cold Pressed Oil is extracted from A1 grade coconuts. This cold-pressed virgin coconut oil is good for your well-being as it is cholesterol-free. 60% MCTs in Tata Simply Better Cold Pressed Coconut Oil helps boost energy. Tata Simply Better Cold Pressed Virgin Coconut Oil can be used for daily cooking and raw consumption.
How to Use:
Cooking: Use cold-pressed virgin coconut oil as a healthy alternative for sautéing, stir-frying, baking, or roasting. Baking: Incorporate the oil into your baking recipes for added flavour and moisture. Spreading: Spread the coconut oil on toast, bread, or crackers as a nutritious and tasty replacement for butter. Skin and Hair Care: Apply the oil topically as a moisturizer, hair mask, or makeup remover for its nourishing properties. Oil Pulling: Swish a tablespoon of coconut oil in your mouth for a few minutes to support oral health. DIY Beauty Products: Use coconut oil as a base ingredient for homemade lip balms, body scrubs, or face masks. Seasoning Cast Iron: Use coconut oil to season cast iron cookware, enhancing its non-stick properties and preventing rust. Storage Instructions: Store in a cool, dry place. Keep away from direct sunlight. ^Contains medium chain fatty acids that are easily metabolized. |

About the Product:
Aashirvaad Svasti Organic Cow Ghee is a unique organic cow ghee that comes with a monthly quality report card on 276 quality parameters, including 218 pesticides, 8 metals and contaminants, and 28 antibiotics. It is made with 100% organic cow milk sourced from 7000+ healthy cows. These cows are raised without the use of chemicals, fertilizers, pesticides, and hormone injections in 600 lush green organic farms in Karnataka, following sustainable practices. The cows are allowed to roam and graze freely and are free from nose ropes, providing them with a natural environment to grow. The cows are milked hygienically with care and are fed 5 different types of organic fodder to ensure good nutrition and health. The organic cow ghee is slowly cooked for 3-4 hours over gradually increased temperatures, lending it a rich nostalgic aroma. With our stringent quality norms, we conduct multiple quality tests at various stages of production to ensure that our organic cow ghee has no pesticides, no growth hormones, and no antibiotics. Now you don't have to worry about getting traditional organic cow ghee for your family.
Benefits:
Comes with a monthly quality report card on 276 quality parameters, including 218 pesticides, 8 metals and contaminants, and 28 antibiotics. Aashirvaad Svasti Organic Cow Ghee has no pesticides, no growth hormones, and no antibiotics. Slowly cooked for 3 hours over gradually increased temperatures that lend it a rich nostalgic aroma. Certifications: Jaivik Bharat India Organic Aditi Organic. Just scan the QR code on the pack to get the monthly report card and take a virtual tour of the farm. |
Storage and Uses:
It can be a great replacement for vegetable oils and butter. It has a high smoking point that can be used for deep frying, shallow frying, etc.

About the Product:
Sonamasuri brown rice is a medium-grain rice variety known for its slightly nutty flavour and chewy texture. This rice retains its bran layer, giving it a distinct brown colour and adding depth to its taste. Popular in Indian cuisine, Sonamasuri brown rice is often used in pilafs, curries, and salads. About the Product:
Panchrangi / Mix Dal is a mixture of five nutritious pulses, i.e. - Arhar Dal, Chana Dal, Masoor Dal, Moong Split Chilka, and Urad Dal Chilka. All these pulses are mixed in a ratio to deliver a balance of fibre and protein without compromising on the unmatched taste. All the pulses are cleaned and processed before mixing and packing to ensure their purity and hygiene. This ensures the mixed dal is healthier, tastier, and cooks uniformly. Besides being a delicious side dish in Indian households, mixed dal has quite a few health benefits. You can prepare the healthy Panchmel dal or Panchratan dal with traditional Indian spices, tempered with clarified ghee, and served with a dollop of freshly whipped white butter. A lip-smacking dish the entire family will love!

Avalakki, also known as compressed rice or beaten rice, as the name recommends are flakes completed by flattening dehisced rice.
These are rigid, bland-tasting, white grains that make softer and tend to swell up to twice their size when soaked in water.
Avalakki considered strong because it doesn't include any cholesterol and saturated fat.
With less sodium content, compressed rice is a strong choice of calorie. It is normally used for making breakfast dishes, which is always a strong choice.
Avalakki is usually soaked in water as they soften and can be inspired with milk and sugar or cooked to create poha, desserts, upma.
It can also be fried to create delicious snacks.

About the Product:
Kodo millet is a traditional grain widely cultivated in India and other parts of Asia. Known for its slightly nutty flavour and firm texture, it is an excellent alternative to rice or wheat. Kodo millet is versatile and can be used in various dishes such as salads, porridge, and pilafs. It cooks relatively quickly and absorbs flavours well, making it suitable for savoury and sweet recipes. This millet is a practical choice for everyday cooking and meal preparation.
How to Use:
Rinse 1 cup of bbRoyal Organic Kodo Millet under cold water until the water runs clear.In a saucepan, bring 2 cups of water to a boil, then add the rinsed millet.Reduce heat to low, cover the saucepan, and let it simmer for about 15 minutes until the millet is tender.Once cooked, fluff the millet gently with a fork and let it cool.Use this cooked millet in your favorite dish, whether it's a stir-fry, salad, or a simple side dish.

About the Product:
bbRoyal Organic Kodo Millet, also known as Varagu Rice, is a premium quality grain that is free from GMOs and synthetic pesticides. Cultivated using organic farming methods, this millet is a rich source of essential nutrients. It offers numerous health benefits such as aiding in digestion, improving heart health, and controlling diabetes. Its high fibre content makes it an excellent choice for weight management. With its unique, slightly nutty flavour, bbRoyal Organic Kodo Millet is a delicious and healthy alternative to traditional rice or wheat, perfect for those seeking a wholesome, organic diet.  BB Royal is a premium brand of organic staples by Big Basket. The entire range of products is sourced from the best of farms and produce to ensure high quality standards.
Nutritional Facts:
Calories: 380,
Carbs: 73 g,
Fat: 4 g,
Protein: 12 g.
How to Use:
Rinse 1 cup of bbRoyal Organic Kodo Millet under cold water until the water runs clear.
In a saucepan, bring 2 cups of water to a boil, then add the rinsed millet.
Reduce heat to low, cover the saucepan, and let it simmer for about 15 minutes until the millet is tender.
Once cooked, fluff the millet gently with a fork and let it cool.
Use this cooked millet in your favorite dish, whether it's a stir-fry, salad, or a simple side dish.

About the Product:
Brown rice is a great option for a delicious, nutritious, and healthy quick-cooking rice meal. Rich in fibre and natural goodness, it also has a delicious nutty flavour. It is processed with unique hydration enhancement technology which retains all the essential nutrients. It has vital health benefits and tastes much better than regular brown rice. There is a significant variation between white rice and brown rice, with the most essential one being that unlike white rice, brown rice has not lost its completeness. This rice is more healthful than polished rice.
How to Use:
Bring a large pot of water to boil using at least 6 cups of water per 1 cup of rice. Rinse* the rice in a fine mesh colander under running water to remove excess starch. Add the rice to the boiling water. Reduce the temperature as necessary to prevent overflow but maintain a steady boil. Boil uncovered for 30 minutes. Drain off the remaining cooking water and return the rice to the pot. Cover the pot and let the rice rest off the heat for 10 minutes. Fluff, season as desired, and serve.

About the Product:
Brown rice is whole grain rice, with the outer hull removed; white rice is the same grain after further milling and polishing to remove the bran layer and germ. Brown rice has a mild, nutty flavour, and is chewier and more nutritious than white rice. Organic Brown Rice is high in selenium - a vital mineral that decreases the chances of developing many illnesses. Just a cup of brown rice can supply at least 80% of our daily manganese necessities.
There is a whole lot of variation between white rice and brown rice, and the most essential one being, unlike white rice, brown rice has not lost its completeness. This rice is more healthful than polished rice. This is cultivated without the use of pesticides, artificial fertilizers or chemicals.
Ingredients:
Brown Rice.

About the Product:
Ponni Boiled Rice is a popular variety known for its versatility and nutritional benefits. It is a type of parboiled rice that is partially boiled in the husk, which helps retain nutrients. Ponni rice is favoured for its soft texture, subtle flavour, and ability to absorb flavours well, making it suitable for various rice dishes across South India and beyond. It's commonly used to make dishes like pulao, biryani, and even idlis and dosas in some regions.

About the Product:
Groundnut oil (or Arachis oil) is a vegetable oil extracted from the groundnut or peanut plant. It has a mild to neutral flavour and is widely used in cooking, baking, and frying. Patanjali groundnut oil is made from carefully selected peanuts that are roasted and then pressed to extract the oil.  This premium-quality groundnut oil is rich in monounsaturated and polyunsaturated fats, which are essential for maintaining good health.

Store in a cool, dry place away from direct sunlight |

About the Product:
Turmeric Powder is one of the key ingredients in cooking. The turmeric (haldi) is finely ground and blends in your recipes to give your dishes flavour & a warm golden yellow hue. It has been formulated without any added preservatives or added colours. Add to your delicious food recipes and rustle up some tasty dishes without worrying about your health. Turmeric powder has several medical benefits as per Ayurveda - some of them are: a natural healing agent for cuts and bruises. Alongside, it helps in quick recovery from cough, cold and sore throat.
Nutritional Facts:
Calories: 25,
Carbs: 4 g,
Fat: 1 g,
Protein: 1 g.
How to Use:
It can be used in soups, stews, stir-fries, curry dishes, smoothies, salads, roasted vegetable dishes, baked goods, and more.
Benefits:
Turmeric and its powerful ingredient, curcumin, have a range of health benefits.
Antioxidants have the potential to prevent heart disease, eye conditions and Alzheimer's.
Anti-inflammatory properties can help people with arthritis.
Turmeric may even reduce the risk or spread of cancer.

product_USP: High Dietary Fibre & Source of Iron
about_the_product:
About the Product:
Tata Sampann Red Rice Poha (Thick) which is made from the nutritionally rich red rice & Rich in natural trace minerals like potassium, calcium and magnesium.
Tata Sampann Red rice is made from Red Rice & Dietary fibre is an essential part of a healthy and balanced diet.
Tata Sampann Red Rice poha contains high fibre and is also a source of iron, Iron helps fighting anaemia and in haemoglobin formation.
Ingredients:
Red Rice Flakes/Flattened red rice
How to Use:
Red Poha with coconut & Jaggery - Take 1 cup of red poha, 2 cup of grated coconut, 1/2 cup of grated jaggery, 1/2 tsp. of cardamom powder and 2-3 tbsp. of warm water.
Mix poha, grated coconut and jaggery together. Add warm water and mix. Add cardamom powder at the end and mix well. Keep it covered and rest it for 10 -15 minutes.
Serve! Red poha recipe – Savoury recipe Wash & strain 1 cup of Tata Sampann red rice poha and keep aside (do not soak) Heat 2 tbsp of oil and splutter mustard and cumin seeds.
Sauté with 1 split chilli and 1 small chopped onion till it turns light pink in colour. Add 1/4th tsp. turmeric power and salt to taste. Add poha, mix and cook well for five minutes. Serve!

About the Product:
BB Royal tamarind is sweet and tasty. Tamarind is high in vitamin C and several B vitamins along with potassium iron and phosphorus. It has been used to break the fever and cool down the body. Traditionally it is also employed to help with digestion issues relieve a sore throat and alleviate sunstroke.
Tamarind contains a variety of biologically active phytochemical compounds which combine with the nutrients of tamarind act in synergy to produce its miraculous benefits. It is an extensively used condiment spice that is necessary for kitchens. One can make a variety of dishes and pickles with these tamarinds.
Nutritional Facts:

Fat: 0 g,
Protein: 3 g.
How to Use:
It is used in sauces, marinades, chutneys, drinks and desserts.
Tamarind is a staple of Indian curries and spicy dishes, where it is often paired with coconut milk to reduce its sour taste.
Benefits:
The polyphenols in tamarind have antioxidant and anti-inflammatory properties.
These can protect against diseases such as heart disease, cancer and diabetes.
The seed extract may also help lower blood sugar, while the pulp extract may help you lose body weight and reverse fatty liver disease.

product_USP: 100% Natural, Zero Cholesterol, Zero Trans Fat
about_the_product:
About the Product:
Max Care Virgin Coconut Oil (VCO) is pure, unrefined, cold pressed oil extracted from fresh coconut milk. The cold process method ensures that all the vital nutrients and the natural goodness of fresh coconuts are retained.
A lot of the coconut oils in the market are made from copra or dehydrated coconut meat using heat. However, Max Care VCO is extracted from fresh coconuts without the use of any heat, making it the finest quality of coconut oil with a delicate, mild aroma & taste, and water like clarity.
Max Care VCO is a superfood, rich in several essential fatty acids and antioxidants, making it one of the healthiest oils for cooking, frying and baking. Apart from cooking, it can also be consumed in its raw form or added to salads, smoothies or food. VCO is rich in lauric acid, which is found naturally only in mothers milk apart from Virgin Coconut Oil.
This lauric acid helps improve immunity and boosts metabolism. Additionally, Max Care VCO can also be used externally on hair & skin and is an excellent natural moisturizer and conditioner that nourishes the skin and hair. Being 100% natural and nutritious, the oil is an excellent massage oil for babies as well.
Benefits:
As Max Care VCO is cold pressed, unrefined and 100% natural. It is an ideal choice for cooking, better than other refined vegetable oils.
It can be used for cooking, frying and baking and can also be consumed in its raw form.
Rich source of good fats, which helps improve immunity, boosts metabolism and promotes weight loss.
When used topically on hair, it reduces hair fall, strengthens hair, fights dandruff and conditions the hair.
When used topically on the skin, it is a great natural moisturizer and body oil.
How to Use:
Apart from cooking, it can also be consumed in its raw form or added to salads, smoothies or food.
VCO is rich in lauric acid, which is found naturally only in mothers milk apart from Virgin Coconut Oil.
This lauric acid helps improve immunity and boosts metabolism.
Additionally, Max Care VCO can also be used externally on hair & skin and is an excellent natural moisturizer and conditioner that nourishes the skin and hair.
Being 100% natural and nutritious, the oil is an excellent massage oil for babies as well.

About the Product:
For most Indians, comfort food is always linked to easy-to-cook homemade meals, and what can be more convenient and quick than preparing a hearty dal meal? Essential in every household, Tata Sampann dals are unpolished and do not undergo any artificial polishing with water, oil, or leather, thereby retaining their goodness and wholesome character. The 5-step process ensures that Tata Sampann grains are uniform and of premium quality, giving you an all-natural, authentic taste. A staple in the Indian diet, Moong Dal Chilka provides nutrients such as protein and fibre. Made of select grains and recommended by Chef Sanjeev Kapoor and Chef Ranveer Brar, Tata Sampann Unpolished Moong Dal Chilka makes for a delicious meal choice. So whenever you are in the mood to cook something easy and delicious, dive into the scrumptious taste of Tata Sampann pulses and enjoy a lovely meal! Explore Tata Sampann Pulses range - Toor dal, Chana dal, Moong dal, Green Moong, Masoor dal, Masoor Small dal, Masoor Whole dal, Kabuli Chana, Urad dal, Urad Whole dal, Urad Kali, Kala Chana, and Rajma.
How to Use:
Store in a cool and dry place. Transfer content in an airtight container after opening. Uses: Split moong beans can be ground in a mill or blender and used to make vegetable fritters. Heat oil in the pressure cooker on medium-high flame. Add cumin seeds, green chili, and sautÃ© for 30 seconds. Add onions, ginger, and garlic. SautÃ© for 3 minutes. Add chopped tomato, spices, and stir. Add lentils and water. Stir well. Cover the lid, turn the heat on high flame, and pressure cook it until you hear two whistles. Now reduce the flame to medium and pressure cook it for another 8 minutes. Let the pressure release naturally. Open the lid and add lime juice and cilantro. Stir and green moong dal is ready to be served. |
Features:

About the Product:
Jeera rice or Zeera rice is an Indian dish consisting of tiny sized rice grains.
Seeraga Samba Rice is a fine, easily digestible, iron-rich aromatic variety rice preferred for making the traditional Biriyani.
Ideal as table rice also. It is finely processed to eliminate foreign grains, dust particles, husk and other impurities.
It has a high nutritional value and is extremely delicious. Best aromatic rice rich in flavour, small grain and raw.
Nutrients rich and helps in easy digestion.

Carbs: 80 g,
Fat: 2 g,
Protein: 6 g.
Benefits:
High fiber.
Aids digestive processes.
Boost energy and mood.
Low glycemic index, thereby lowering the impact of raised blood sugar.
Lowers cholesterol.
How to Use:
Raw rice should typically be prepared with double the quantity of water.
One cup of rice should be added to at least two cups of boiling water.
Once it is cooked, it should be covered and left to stand before it is drained.
Serve this rice along with Dal or curry of your choice.

About the Product:
Brown Basmati rice is a whole grain variety of rice that retains its bran layer and germ, giving it a nutty flavour and slightly chewy texture. It is a healthier alternative to white rice as it contains more fibre, vitamins, and minerals. Brown Basmati rice is known for its distinct aroma, long grains, and ability to cook into fluffy, separate grains. It is commonly used in Indian and Middle Eastern cuisines to prepare dishes such as pilafs, biryanis, and side dishes. Brown Basmati rice is valued for its nutritional benefits and delicious flavour profile.
How to Use:
You simply cannot think of exotic Indian dishes such as biriyani and pulao without basmati rice. And if you are looking for continental delights you can make some fine risotto with Dawaat basmati too!

About the Product:
Masoor Black Whole, also known as whole black lentils or beluga lentils, are prized for their rich, earthy flavour and high nutritional value. These lentils are packed with protein, fibre, and essential minerals such as iron and magnesium. Their firm texture holds up well in cooking, making them ideal for soups, stews, and salads. Masoor Black Whole lentils are a versatile ingredient, perfect for adding depth and nutrition to the dishes.
How to Use:
Use masoor to make dal, the classic Indian Masoor Dal.Boil the lentils to a stew-like consistency with vegetables and then season with a mixture of spices to make a tasty accompaniment for rice and rotis.

About the Product:
Finger millet belongs to the family Poaceae and is known as Ragi in India.
Ragi flour in Karnataka is mostly used to make balls, popularly known as “ragi mudda".
24 Mantra Organic Ragi flour/ Ragi Atta is made from unadulterated whole grain.
These Ragi grains are not coloured with any artificial colours.
Ragi is a good source of complex carbohydrates, a fair source of protein and a good source of fibre and is very low in fat. Ragi flour/ Ragi Atta is rich in fibre and contributes towards fullness which contributes towards achieving the ideal body weight.

product_desc: Refined Sunflower Oil - Trans Fat Free, Healthy Cooking Oil
A2 Desi Cow Ghee, Rich Aroma, Traditional Bilona Method
about_the_product:
From the Brand:
Why Fresho OrganicA2 Desi Cow Ghee is special?

Fresho Organic A2 Cow Ghee is churned from the milk of cows carrying the A2 beta-casein protein gene.


The nutrient-rich milk of Karnataka's Malnad Gidda and Hallikar cows packs our Ghee with essential vitamins and fatty acids.







Why Fresho OrganicA2 Desi Cow Ghee is special

Fresho Organic A2 Cow Ghee is churned from the milk of cows carrying the A2 beta-casein protein gene. 


The nutrient-rich milk of Karnataka's Malnad Gidda and Hallikar cows packs our Ghee with essential vitamins and fatty acids.








Good for lactose insensitivities


It’s protein is easier to digest


Collected from a single farm




Vedic method used in its preparation


Sources from grass-fed cows


Dripping with healthy fats





Prepared by Vedic Bilona method

 


The centuries-old Bilona method of extracting cultured butter from curd.


Slow-cooking it over a gentle flame, gives us the purest, most traditional form of Desi Ghee.


This process infuses Bilona Ghee with its authentic notes of flavour and nutty aroma.






Tested at NABL Accredited Labs andcertified by ADITI Organic Certification Body
Ensure that your Ghee remains fresh and flavourful bystoring it tightly closed in a cool and dry place





About the Product













Authentic Organic A2 Cow Ghee: Fresho Organic A2 Cow Ghee is made from the milk of cows that carry the A2 beta-casein protein gene. Known for its easy digestibility, this protein is particularly beneficial for those with lactose sensitivities.
Produced With Organic A2 Cow Milk: Our Ghee is crafted from the milk of local cow breeds of Karnataka, including Malnad Gidda and Hallikar. This nutrient-dense milk infuses our Ghee with essential vitamins and fatty acids, narrating a rich, authentic tale.
Single Source Farm: The milk for our Ghee originates from a single farm, devoid of factory-farming practices. We maintain absolute control from the collection to the production of the milk, ensuring its organic quality is nothing short of the highest standard.
Traditional Bilona Method: We employ the centuries old Bilona method to produce our Ghee. Cultured butter is extracted from curd and slowly cooked over a gentle flame, resulting in the purest and most traditional form of Desi Ghee. This meticulous churning and simmering process lends our Bilona Ghee its unique flavour and nutty aroma.
Rich and Full-Bodied: Prepared using the Vedic method, our Ghee retains the unique attributes of traditional Indian Ghee. Its robust, velvety granules, healthy fats, golden hue, and silky texture contribute to its distinctive richness.
Pasture-Raised Cows: Our cows graze freely on green pastures and consume only organic grains. This ensures that the milk used in our Ghee is fresh and enhances its flavour, aroma, and nutritional quality. The cows' feed is grown organically, without any chemicals or pesticides.
Certified and Lab Tested: To assure its authenticity, Fresho Organic A2 Cow Ghee undergoes testing at NABL Accredited Labs for nutritional and quality standards and is certified by the ADITI Organic Certification Body.
Ingredients:
Organic milk fat (Made from A2 cow milk)
Nutritional Facts:
Nutritional Values Per 100g*

Energy (kcal)899.01
Carbohydrate (g) 99.89
Protein (g) 64.96
Total fat (g) 1.49
Saturated fat (g)
Trans fat (g) 30.47
MUFA fat (g) 2.97
PUFA fat (g) 280.34
Cholesterol (mg) 0
Sodium (mg) 6
Vitamin A 0
How to Use:
Ready to use 
Best used for cooking, tempering, and flavouring
Storage information: Store in ambient temperature, dry and hygienic place, away from sunlight.
Ensure that your Ghee remains fresh and flavourful by storing it tightly closed in a cool and dry place. The high-quality glass jar used to package the Ghee helps retain its original quality while preserving it for longer.
Other Product Info:

About the Product:
Misri, also known as Whole Sugar Candy, is a type of crystallised sugar commonly used in Indian cuisine. These translucent, crystalline chunks are known for their mild sweetness and pleasant crunch. Misri is often used as a natural sweetener in beverages, desserts, and traditional sweets. It is also enjoyed as a palate cleanser after meals. The large sugar crystals can be dissolved in drinks or eaten directly, making Misri a versatile addition to various culinary applications.

About the Product:
Eastern Condiments, Your Perfect Taste Partner, specialises in the production and distribution of ready-to-use spices, masala blends, rice powders, coffee, tea, pickles, and more. Features:
Have you met your Perfect taste partner yet? The Perfect match is waiting for you! Contains all of the flavours needed for creating the Perfect zing in Sambhar, the Perfect partner for steamed rice, idlis, and dosas! No added colour, no preservatives, no additives.

About the Product:
Lobia is a certain type of bean, which has a little oval structure with a black eye on it. It can be added to several cuisines starting from Dal to the salad. Red Lobia or China Bean is a soft bean and there is no need to soak it as it cooks simply. These are rich in soluble, fibre, protein, folate, complex carbohydrates, and iron. They are well non for their texture and their ability to absorb flavours. It contains high freshness, outstanding taste, and high nutritional value.
Nutritional Facts:
Calories: 336,
Carbs: 60 g,
Fat: 1 g,
Protein: 24 g.
How to Use:
In traditional Southern cuisine, the cooked beans are mixed with meat, spices, and leafy greens.
It can be added to a variety of recipes, including soups, stews, and salads.
Benefits:
Rich in Folate, Vitamin B9.
High Fibre.
Rich in Magnesium.
Zinc Rich.
Provides 34% of Iron (Fe) Requirements.
Rich in Vitamin B1, Thiamine.

About the Product:
Masoor black whole refers to whole black lentils, also known as black masoor dal. These lentils are small, round legumes with a black outer skin and a creamy interior when cooked. They are rich in protein, fibre, and essential nutrients such as iron and folate. Black masoor dal is commonly used in Indian cuisine for dishes like dal makhani, providing a hearty texture and distinctive flavour.
How to Use:
Use masoor to make dal, the classic Indian Masoor Dal. Boil the lentils to a stew-like consistency with vegetables and then season with a mixture of spices to make a tasty accompaniment for rice and rotis.

About the Product:
Masoor black whole, also known as whole black lentils or black gram, is a type of lentil known for its robust flavour and nutritional benefits. These lentils are small, round, and black in colour with a glossy exterior. Masoor black whole is commonly used in Indian cuisine to prepare dishes such as dal (lentil curry), soups, stews, and as a key ingredient in traditional dishes like dal makhani.
How to Use:
Use masoor to make dal, the classic Indian Masoor Dal.Boil the lentils to a stew-like consistency with vegetables and then season with a mixture of spices to make a tasty accompaniment for rice and rotis.

About the Product:
Everest Dry Mango Powder, or Aamchur, is a tangy spice essential in Indian cuisine. Made from dried unripe mangoes, it adds a zesty, citrusy flavour to dishes. Aamchur is prized for its sourness, balancing flavours in chutneys, marinades, and curries. Its fine texture and intense aroma elevate both vegetarian and meat dishes, enhancing taste with a hint of fruity tartness. A versatile ingredient, Everest Dry Mango Powder is also used in snacks like chaats and pickles, offering a unique tang that makes it a pantry staple for those seeking to enrich their culinary creations with authentic Indian flavours.

About the Product:
Barley is a wonderfully versatile cereal grain with a rich nutlike flavour and a tempting chewy, pasta-like reliability. Barley has twice the calcium and fiber and about 30 percent fewer calories. The two are equivalent in protein and fat content. Ultimately, both grains are healthy choices and getting a variety from both is best.
It is a very superior source of molybdenum, selenium, manganese and dietary fibre, and delivers copper, chromium, vitamin B1, magnesium, phosphorus and niacin. It helps you lose weight because of essential amino acids. It helps stabilize blood pressure and reduces symptoms of arthritis. It helps to prevent Osteoporosis and it is rich in phosphorus, calcium, and Vitamin C which are great for healthy bones and teeth.
Nutritional Facts:
Calorie: 345,
Carbs: 75 g,
Fat: 2 g,
Protein: 11 g.
How to Use:
It can be used to make nutritious soups, stews, or health drinks with lemon.
Just like you cook oats, boil barley in water and add to a bowl of milk, honey, cinnamon, fruits, nuts and seeds.
Benefits:
Reduces hunger and may help you lose weight.
Insoluble and soluble fiber content improves digestion.
May prevent gallstones and reduce your risk of gallbladder surgery.
Beta-Glucans may help lower cholesterol. 5. May reduce heart disease risk.

About the Product:
Fennel, also known as saunf, offers a refreshing flavour and aroma. These small seeds are perfect for culinary use, enhancing dishes with their sweet, anise-like taste. Ideal for seasoning, baking, and tea, fennel is cherished for its digestive benefits and versatility in cooking, making it a staple in any kitchen.
How to Use:
Saunf is often used in Tadka or tempering of dishes and in pickles and chutneys.The seeds are chewed by many as an after-dinner 'mint' and can often be seen in Indian restaurants to take as a digestive on the way out.

About the Product:
Saunf is known as Fennel, It is a fragrant and tasty herb that has a few culinary and additional therapeutic effects. Saunf is an integral flavouring agent and it’s the soul of many Indian dishes. Saunf is a cooling and sweet-smelling herb that is utilized in different cooking preparations as well. It has a perfumed smell and taste. It is a greenish-brown, small oval seed from a plant in the parsley family.
Nutritional Facts:
Calories: 25,
Carbs: 3 g,
Fat: 1 g,
Protein: 1 g.
How to Use:
Saunf is often used in Tadka or tempering of dishes and in pickles and chutneys.
The seeds are chewed by many as an after-dinner 'mint' and can often be seen in Indian restaurants to take as a digestive on the way out.
Benefits:
Potassium present in fennel seeds helps in regulating blood pressure.
Saunf has been found to be highly effective in the treatment of asthma.
Anti-inflammatory and antispasmodic properties found in fennel help clear the sinuses and relieve asthma symptoms by having a soothing effect on the throat and the airways.

About the Product:
Cashew nuts contain vitamins and minerals which help in boosting healthy blood and immune system.  Cashew contains copper and iron which help the body to form and utilise red blood cells which help to keep blood vessels, nerves, the immune system and bones healthy. Cashews are widely used as an ingredient Cashew nuts are eaten on their own as a snack or as an ingredient in various sweet and savoury dishes as it adds flavour and taste to the dish.
Benefits:
Cashew has good fats, which are recommended for a healthy body.
The fat present in cashew nuts is responsible for the growth of good cholesterol and reduction of the bad cholesterol.
Cashew gives a lot of energy and also keeps you satiated for a long time.

Carbs: 21 g

Protein: 19 g

It can be used in candy bars, sweets and pastries.
Splits are crisper than wholes and are sometimes preferred for that reason.

About the Product:
Everest presents their authentic range of masalas that are blended with a wide variety of handpicked and selected spices that bring a whole new flavour and meaning to your dishes. Rake up your favourite recipes and cuisines by adding this magical blend of Everest masalas.
Ingredients:
Rock salt, Black salt, Dry mango, Cumin, Pomegranate seed, Black Pepper, Dry Ginger, Chilli, Mint leaf, Nutmeg, Bishop's weed, Malic acid and Asafoetida
How to Use:
Boil, chop and fry 500g potatoes till slightly golden. Remove in a bowl and cool. Add 2 tbsp mint chutney, 1 tbsp lemon juice, 1/2 inch chopped ginger, 1 chopped green chilli and salt to taste. Mix well. Sprinkle 1 tbsp Everest Chaat masala. Toss. Add chopped coriander leaves. Serve fresh.

About the Product:
Soya Beans contain 40 percent protein. It has the highest protein content amongst plant products. Soya is often used to replace the animal proteins in an individual's diet. Soybeans offer a wealth of benefits, including their ability to improve metabolism, help in healthy weight gain, protect heart health, and reduce the effects of menopause. They improve digestion, promote bone health, protect against birth defects, increase circulation, decrease the risk of diabetes, and generally tone up the body.
Nutritional Facts:
Calories: 240,
Carbs: 14 g,
Fat: 13 g,
Protein: 18 g.
How to Use:
Soybeans are processed for their oil (see uses below) and meal (for the animal feed industry).
A smaller percentage is processed for human consumption and made into products including soy milk, soy flour, soy protein, tofu, and many retail food products.
Soybeans are also used in many non-food (industrial) products.
Benefits:
High in fibre.
High in protein.
Low in saturated fat.
Cholesterol and lactose-free.

About the Product:
Soya Beans contain 40 percent protein. It has the highest protein content amongst plant products. Soya is often used to replace the animal proteins in an individual's diet. Soybeans offer a wealth of benefits, including their ability to improve metabolism, help in healthy weight gain, protect heart health, and reduce the effects of menopause. They improve digestion, promote bone health, protect against birth defects, increase circulation, decrease the risk of diabetes, and tone up the body.
Nutritional Facts:
Calories: 240,
Carbs: 14 g,
Fat: 13 g,
Protein: 18 g.
How to Use:
Soybeans are processed for their oil (see uses below) and meal (for the animal feed industry).
A smaller percentage is processed for human consumption and made into products including soy milk, soy flour, soy protein, tofu and many retail food products.
Soybeans are also used in many non-food (industrial) products.
Benefits:
High in fibre.
High in protein.
Low in saturated fat.
Cholesterol and lactose-free.
A reliable source of omega-3 fatty acids and an antioxidant.

About the Product:
Sugar Free Gold is your healthier alternative to sugar. It is made from aspartame, a protein derivative. It is a nutritious, safe, and ideal low-calorie sugar substitute, giving you the sweetness and taste of sugar but with negligible calories to worry about! Sugar-Free Gold helps you to cut down on excess calories from sugar to keep you fit. While an hour of walking may help you to lose 350 calories (approx.), by making Sugar Free a part of your fitness plan, you can avoid 500 calories a day. Burning calories is difficult; avoiding them is easy with Sugar-Free Gold. One measured spoon (of 0.5 grams provided inside the pack) is equivalent in sweetness to one teaspoon of sugar.
Storage and Uses:
Sugar Free Gold is a healthy alternative to sugar. Made with aspartame, a protein derivative, Sugar Free Gold is a low-calorie substitute with the sweetness and taste of sugar. Store in a clean, dry place in an airtight container. It is an ideal substitute as one sachet in sweetness is equivalent to a teaspoon of sugar. It can help you avoid almost 500 calories a day, as avoiding calories is easier than burning them. Sugar Free Gold is a boon for health-conscious people and diabetics.
Other Product Info:

About the Product:
Misri, also known as Diamond Sugar, is a type of confectionery sugar used extensively in Indian cuisine and traditional practices. Misri crystals are beautifully diamond-shaped, lending to its unique name. This unrefined sugar is made by continually pouring sugar syrup into large, shallow containers, where it crystallises into small, rock-like structures.    Misri is not just used as a sweetener in Indian desserts, but also holds significant cultural and religious value. It is often used in religious ceremonies, offered as prasad (blessed food) or used in rituals. Misri also plays a key role in Ayurveda for its numerous health benefits. It is believed to aid in digestion, provide instant energy when mixed with warm water or milk.    Despite its sweetness, Misri is considered healthier than refined sugar due to its natural and unprocessed nature. Its distinct texture, sweetness, and cultural significance make it a cherished ingredient in Indian households.

About the Product:
Dabur Hommade Ginger Garlic paste is made from freshest garlic paste and ground ginger paste in one hygienically sealed bag. The time one spends peeling, grinding and pasting these spices can now be saved with Dabur Hommade’s Ginger Garlic Paste. Every ingredient used in our ginger garlic paste recipe is fresh – right from the ginger that is sourced from North-Eastern states to the garlic that is sourced from Gujarat. Our Homemade range is an inspiration for seasoned cooks, experimental folks who like to try cooking and aspiring chefs-to-be. 

Our Ginger Garlic Paste contains no Added Colours. 
It is thick and grainy, providing the texture of freshly ground paste at Home.  
2 tbsp of our Homemade Ginger Garlic Paste is equivalent to 1.25 cm long ginger piece and 4-6 cloves of garlic, make sure you use in recipes accordingly.
Speaking of recipes, it is great to be used in Rasams, Kebabs, Sambhar, Matar Paneer, Malai Kofta.
Freshest ingredients always - the taste of Homemade!
Ingredients:
Ginger, Garlic, Water, Salt, Acidity Regulator (INS 296) & Stabilizer (INS 415)
How to Use:
Add this paste to dishes like curries, dals, and vegetable meals as well as Chinese and Western cuisines. 
Use this paste in the same stage of cooking as fresh ginger and garlic. Other Homemade options include ginger, garlic, and tamarind paste, as well as coconut milk, tomato puree, capsicum and lemoneez.

About the Product:
Experience the exquisite flavour and aroma of over 150 years of award-winning heritage with Bertolli Olive Oils. Thus, each batch of Bertolli Extra Virgin Olive Oil is First Cold Pressed. We perform no additional refining, heating, processing or adulterants like Argemone Oil. This means that you get the purest quality of Olive Oil that meets the highest standards of taste, fragrance and nutrition. Not to mention, every container is ecologically packaged to minimize harm to the environment and prevent spoiling from exposure to heat, air and even light while still being transparent for your trust and convenience.
Besides its many well-known health benefits, Extra Virgin Olive Oil has a full-bodied, superior taste and low acidity. It is bold in taste but delicate & rich at the same time. Use it to garnish your bland salads with the exotic sensibility of fresh olives. Enhance your dips, marinades and chutneys with super nutrition, experiment with Italian Soups, Pasta, Spaghetti or Biscotti and savour the authentic flavour of the Mediterranean right in your Indian cuisines. The possibilities are just limitless with Bertolli Extra Virgin Olive Oil that comes in 1 Litre and 500 ml bottles.

About the Product:
Red rice is known for its medicinal purposes and can be used for making culinary delights.
It is unhulled or partially hulled rice with a red husk.
It is a great source of fiber and can help remove toxins from the body.
It is good for heart health as it soaks up cholesterol and feeds the fine bacteria in the intestines.
Red rice has proanthocyanidins, plant pigments which inform to foods a ruddy, purplish colour.
Nutritional Facts:
Calories: 168,
Carbs: 38 g,
Fat: 1 g,
Protein: 3 g.
How to Use:
Raw rice should typically be prepared with double the quantity of water.
One cup of rice should be added to at least two cups of boiling water.
Once it is cooked, it should be covered and left to stand before it is drained.
Serve this rice along with Dal or curry of your choice.
Benefits:
High fiber.
Aids digestive processes.
Boost energy and mood.
Low glycemic index, thereby lowering the impact of raised blood sugar.
Lowers cholesterol.

product_USP: Great Taste & Nutrition, Rich in Protein, 100% Organic Arhar/Tur Dal
about_the_product:
About the Product:
Aashirvaad, a brand that you love and trust, ensures that good quality products reach your kitchen. Hence, it brings to you a range of organic products that are certified by the leading organic product body. Aashirvaad Organic Arhar/Tur Dal adheres to stringent quality checks and organic product norms. It has been expertly sourced and hygienically packed to give you both taste and nutrition. Tur dal is one of the popular dals used widely in Indian cuisine. It can be used to make delicious dals like dal fry and dal tadka, tasty dishes like dal dhoklis and handvo, and flavoursome Rasam powders. A versatile ingredient, arhar dal is also nutritious; it is rich in protein*, dietary fibre**, and is a source of iron***. So enjoy your favourite meals as Aashirvaad brings to you 100% organic products. *As per the protein content of tur/arhar dal given in the Indian Food Composition Tables (IFCT) 2017 NIN. **As per dietary fibre content of arhar/tur dal given in the Indian Food Composition Tables (IFCT) 2017 NIN. ***As per iron content of arhar/tur dal given in the Indian Food Composition Tables (IFCT) 2017 NIN.

About the Product:
Sabudana, also known as sago, is a starchy substance common in Indian cuisine. Derived from the pith of tropical palm trees, it's popularly consumed during religious fasting periods. Sabudana is often processed into small, pearl-like balls that turn translucent when cooked. Its mild flavour makes it a versatile ingredient, suitable for both sweet and savory dishes. Sabudana Khichdi, a spiced tapioca dish, and Sabudana Vada, a deep-fried snack, are classic examples of its use. For dessert, it's often used in puddings like Sabudana Kheer. Its unique texture and taste make it a culinary delight.

About the Product:
Cumin powder has a warm, earthy flavour with a slight bitterness and is widely used in cuisines around the world. Cumin powder is a key ingredient in spice blends like garam masala and curry powder. It is used to season curries, soups, stews, rice dishes, and roasted vegetables. Cumin powder enhances the flavour of dishes and adds depth and complexity to both savoury and sometimes even sweet recipes.
How to Use:

About the Product:

1. Store in a cool and dry place 2. Keep away from moisture

About the Product:
Ponni Boiled Rice is grown without the usage of any chemical pesticides and hence has great taste and aroma. It has an excellent source of protein and is high in nutrients. It is finely processed to remove foreign grains, husk, dust particles and other impurities. It is free from all artificial colours and harmful adulterants. It is a delicious taste and a fine texture.
Ingredients:
Ponni Boiled Rice
Nutritional Facts:
Calories: 160,
Fat: 0 g,
Protein: 3 g
How to Use:
Gently wash the rice with drinking water. Soak it in water for 2-3 minutes. For better cooking results soak 30 minutes prior to cooking. Drain the water and add flakes to the pan.
Electric Cooker: Add 1 cup of rice to 2.0 cups of water and place it in an electric cooker, switch it on, and wait for approximately 20 to 25 minutes. Allow it to cool for a few minutes and take out the rice to serve.
Pressure Cooker: Add 1 cup of rice to 2.0 cups of water either directly in a pressure cooker or in compartment vessels, close the pressure cooker properly, put whistle weight and keep the cooker on medium flame. Switch off the flame once 3 whistles are completed. Allow it to cool till the pressure in the cooker comes down completely, remove the weight and open the cooker to take out the rice to serve.
Note: Water ratio may vary slightly for open cookware cooking when compared to pressure cooking. Water ratio may vary based on the texture of rice you deserve to have like a firm, soft, sticky.
